==Events==
* [[598]] &ndash; [[Maurice's Balkan campaigns#Renewed campaigns, 597–602|Balkan Campaign]]: The [[Eurasian Avars|Avars]] lift the [[siege]] at the [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] stronghold of [[Constanța|Tomis]]. Their leader [[Bayan I]] retreats north of the [[Danube|Danube River]] after the [[Avar Khaganate|Avaro]]-[[Slavs|Slavic]] hordes are decimated by the [[Plague (disease)|plague]].
*[[1282]] &ndash; The people of [[Sicily]] rebel against the [[Capetian House of Anjou|Angevin]] [[monarch|king]] [[Charles I of Naples|Charles I]], in what becomes known as the [[Sicilian Vespers]].
*[[1296]] &ndash; [[Edward I of England|Edward I]] [[Capture of Berwick (1296)|sacks]] [[Berwick-upon-Tweed]], during armed conflict between [[Scotland]] and [[England]].
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: [[Sixth Coalition]] forces [[Battle of Paris (1814)|march into]] [[Paris]].
*[[1815]] &ndash; [[Joachim Murat]] issues the [[Rimini Proclamation]] which would later inspire [[Italian Unification]].
*[[1822]] &ndash; The [[Florida Territory]] is created in the [[United States]].
*[[1841]] &ndash; The [[National Bank of Greece]] is founded in [[Athens]].
*[[1842]] &ndash; [[Diethyl ether|Ether]] [[anesthesia]] is used for the first time, in an operation by the American surgeon [[Physician|Dr.]] [[Crawford Long]].
*[[1844]] &ndash; One of the most [[Battle of Santiago (1844)|important battles]] of the [[Dominican War of Independence]] from [[Haiti]] takes place near the city of [[Santiago de los Caballeros]].
*[[1855]] &ndash; [[Origins of the American Civil War]]: [[Bleeding Kansas]] &ndash; "[[Border Ruffians]]" from [[Missouri]] invade [[Kansas]] and force election of a pro-[[slavery]] legislature.
*[[1856]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Paris (1856)|Treaty of Paris]] is signed, ending the [[Crimean War]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; Danish prince [[George I of Greece|Wilhelm Georg]] is chosen as King George of [[Greece]].
*[[1867]] &ndash; [[Alaska]] is [[Alaska Purchase|purchased]] from [[Russia]] for $7.2 million, about 2-cent/acre ($4.19/km²), by [[United States Secretary of State]] [[William H. Seward]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; [[Texas]] is readmitted to the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] following [[Reconstruction era (United States)|Reconstruction]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; The [[Battle for Kushka]] triggers the [[Panjdeh Incident]] which nearly gives rise to war between the [[British Empire]] and [[Russian Empire]].
*[[1899]] &ndash; German Society of Chemistry issues an invitation to other national scientific organizations to appoint delegates to the [[Commission on Isotopic Abundances and Atomic Weights|International Committee on Atomic Weights]].
*[[1909]] &ndash; The [[Queensboro Bridge]] opens, linking [[Manhattan]] and [[Queens]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; The [[Mississippi Legislature]] founds [[The University of Southern Mississippi]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[King of Morocco|Sultan]] [[Abdelhafid of Morocco|Abdelhafid]] signs the [[Treaty of Fez]], making [[Morocco]] a [[France|French]] [[protectorate]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; Outburst of bloody [[March Days|March Events]] in [[Baku]] and other locations of [[Baku Governorate]].
*[[1939]] &ndash; The [[Heinkel He 100]] fighter sets a world airspeed record of 463&nbsp;mph (745km/h).
*1939 &ndash; ''[[Detective Comics]]'' #27 is released, introducing [[Batman]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)|Sino-Japanese War]]: [[Japan]] declares [[Nanjing|Nanking]] capital of a new [[Reorganized National Government of China|Chinese puppet government]], nominally controlled by [[Wang Jingwei]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Allies of World War II|Allied]] bombers conduct their most severe [[Bombing of Sofia in World War II|bombing run]] on [[Sofia]], [[Kingdom of Bulgaria|Bulgaria]].
*  1944   &ndash; Allied [[Strategic bombing|bombing raid]] on [[Nuremberg]]. Along the English eastern coast 795 aircraft are despatched, including 572 [[Avro Lancaster|Lancaster]]s, 214 [[Handley Page Halifax|Halifaxe]]s and 9 [[de Havilland Mosquito|Mosquito]]s. The bombers meet resistance at the coasts of [[Belgium]] and the [[Netherlands]] from German fighters. In total, 95 bombers are lost, making it the largest [[RAF Bomber Command]] loss of World War II.
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: [[Soviet Union]] [[Red Army|forces]] invade [[Austria]] and take [[Vienna]]; [[Armia Ludowa|Polish]] and Soviet forces liberate [[Gdańsk|Danzig]].
*[[1949]] &ndash; A [[1949 anti-NATO riot in Iceland|riot breaks out in Austurvöllur]] square in [[Reykjavík]], when [[Iceland]] joins [[NATO]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; The [[Yonge–University–Spadina line|Yonge Street subway line]] opens in [[Toronto]]. It is the first [[rapid transit|subway]] in [[Canada]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; The [[Single Convention on Narcotic Drugs]] is signed in [[New York City]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; ''[[Jeopardy!]]'', hosted by [[Art Fleming]] debuted.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: A [[car bomb]] explodes in front of the [[United States Embassy, Saigon]], killing 22 and wounding 183 others.
*[[1972]] &ndash; Vietnam War: The [[Easter Offensive]] begins after [[North Vietnam]]ese forces cross into the [[Demilitarized Zone]] (DMZ) of [[South Vietnam]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; The first [[Land Day]] protests are held in Israel/Palestine.
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Airey Neave]], a British [[Member of Parliament#United Kingdom|Member of Parliament]], is killed by a car bomb as he exits the [[Palace of Westminster]]. The [[Irish National Liberation Army]] claims responsibility.
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Ronald Reagan]] is [[Reagan assassination attempt|shot in the chest]] outside a [[Washington, D.C.]], hotel by [[John Hinckley, Jr.]] Another two people are wounded at the same time.
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Space Shuttle program]]: [[STS-3]] Mission is completed with the landing of [[Space Shuttle Columbia|''Columbia'']] at [[White Sands Missile Range]], [[New Mexico]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; The United Kingdom [[Terrorism Act 2006]] becomes a law.
*[[2009]] &ndash; Twelve gunmen [[2009 Lahore police academy attacks|attack]] the [[Manawan Police Academy]] in [[Lahore]], [[Pakistan]].
